spell.name: Ki Blast
entries: A beam of explosive energy streaks toward a creature within range. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d8} force damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d8}), 11th level ({@damage 3d8}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d8}).

spell.name: Heat Vision
entries: You shoot beams of fire from your eyes at a creature in range. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d8} fire damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d8}), 11th level ({@damage 3d8}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d8}).

spell.name: Freezing Breath
entries: You breath absolute zero temperature cold in front of you. Choose one creature you can see within range, or choose two creatures you can see within range that are within 5 feet of each other. A target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 1d6} cold damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d6}), 11th level ({@damage 3d6}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d6}).

spell.name: Crystal Shard
entries: You propel a razor-sharp crystal shard at your target. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d6} points of piercing damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d6}), 11th level ({@damage 3d6}), and 17th level ({@damage 4d6}).

spell.name: Empathic Feedback
entries: You empathically share your pain and suffering with your attacker. While under the effects of this spell, if a creature hits you with a melee attack, it takes damage equal to the amount of damage you received or 5 points of damage, whichever is less. This damage cannot be increased or reduced in any way. The damage from empathic feedback has no type, so even if you took fire damage from a creature that has immunity to fire, empathic feedback damages the attacker.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage an attacker can receive is equal to the amount of damage you received or 5 points of damage plus another 5 points of damage for each slot level above 1st, whichever is less.

spell.name: Bestow Power
entries: You link your mind with another creature who is able to cast spells, creating a brief conduit through which magical energy can be shared. When you cast this spell, the affected creature gains 1 spell slot or the equivalent number of spell points.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the number of spell slots the target gains increases by 1 for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Deja Vu
entries: Choose a creature that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or repeat the same actions it took on its previous turn. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

spell.name: Anticipatory Strike

time.condition: which you take at the start of another creatures turn

entries: The air reverberates with an eager hum as your movements pick up speed. You take your turn for this round of combat immediately after casting this spell, rather than waiting for your turn to come up in the initiative sequence. Once you use this spell, you cannot do so again until after your next turn has passed.

spell.name: Damp Power

time.condition: which you take when you are hit by an attack

entries: An amber aura quickly spreads over your body, moderating the effects of the environment. When you cast this spell, you are protected from the vagaries of destructive energies directed against you.

All variable numeric effects of the triggering attack are decreased to its minimum possible value. For instance, if you are struck by the fireball spell which usually deals 8d6 points of damage, while protected by damp power, you would take only 8 points of damage. If the attack affects an area—as the spell fireball does, its effect is only minimized for you. Other creatures in the area are affected normally.

spell.name: Feat Leech
entries: You can use another creature's feats for yourself. When you touch a willing creature, you are immediately familiar with the target’s feats (if any), and you can choose a number of these feats to “leech” equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of one).

For the duration of the spell, you are treated as if you possess the leeched feats, despite the fact that you have more feats than normally allowed. During this same period, the target can make no use of the leeched feats.

When the spell ends, you lose access to the feats, and the target gains immediate use of them. This transfer occurs regardless of the distance between you and the target. If the target is killed before the duration expires, you immediately lose the benefit of the stolen feats.
You cannot leech a feat for which you do not meet the prerequisites. However, you can use a leeched feat as the prerequisite for another leeched feat.

spell.name: Kiman's Counterattack

time.condition: which you take when you see a creature within 60 feet of you making a melee weapon attack

entries: You attempt to interrupt a creature in the process of making an attack. You make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 10 + the triggering creature’s proficiency bonus.
On a success, the creature's attack fails, has no effect and one creature of your choice within 5 feet of the triggering creature can make one melee weapon attack against the triggering creature.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the triggering creature’s proficiency bonus is reduced by one for the purposes of making the ability check for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Kiman's Double Cast
entries: Choose a willing creature that you can see within range. Until the spell ends, it can use its bonus action to cast another spell. The spell must normally have a casting time of 1 bonus action.
When the spell ends, the creature can't move or take actions until after its next turn, as a wave of lethargy sweeps over it.

spell.name: Kiman's Energy Defense

time.condition: which you take when you take force, necrotic, psychic or radiant damage from a spell

entries: The spell captures some of the incoming magical energy, lessening its effect on you. You have resistance to the triggering damage type until the start of your next turn.

spell.name: Kiman's Magical Plate
entries: While not wearing armor or a shield, a protective magical force surrounds you until the spell ends.
Your base AC becomes 13 + your spellcasting ability modifier (maximum equal to your proficiency bonus). The spell ends if you don armor or a shield or if you dismiss the spell as an action.

spell.name: Kiman's Majestic Hound

m.text: a cuddly toy rabbit, a plastic mask

entries: You gain the service of a blink dog, except it has a speed of 100 feet and is small in size. Appearing in an unoccupied space within range.

The blink dog acts independently of you, but it always obeys your commands. In combat, it rolls its own initiative and acts on its own turn. The blink dog can't attack, but it can take other actions as normal.

When the blink dog drops to 0 hit points, it disappears, leaving behind no physical form. It reappears after you cast this spell again. As an action, you can temporarily dismiss the blink dog to a pocket dimension. Alternatively, you can dismiss it forever. As an action while it is temporarily dismissed, you can cause it to reappear in any unoccupied space within 30 feet of you. Whenever the blink dog drops to 0 hit points or disappears into the pocket dimension, it leaves behind in its space anything it was wearing or carrying.

While the blink dog is within 100 feet of you, you can speak and understand the blink dog language. You can't have a blink dog and a familiar at the same time. If you cast this spell while you already have a familiar, you instead cause it to adopt the form of the blink dog.

Finally, when you cast a spell with a range of touch, the blink dog can deliver the spell as if it had cast the spell. The blink dog must be within 100 feet of you, and it must use its reaction to deliver the spell when you cast it. If the spell requires an attack roll, you use your attack modifier for the roll.

spell.name: Kiman's Metagaming

m.text: a book called the game master’s guide

entries: You divine certain information about a foe’s capabilities to aid you in combat. The target must succeed on an Intelligence saving throw. On a failure, roll 2d4, to learn two of the following characteristics:

items.name: One
items.entry: One of the creature’s senses, alignment or creature type.

items.name: Two
items.entry: One of the creature’s speed types and its value, current hit points or armor class.

items.name: Three
items.entry: One of the creature’s damage resistances or damage immunities.

items.name: Four
items.entry: One of the creature’s ability scores.

spell.name: Kiman's Mind Over Matter

time.condition: which you take when you roll an attack roll or an ability check

entries: You momentarily assert your own sheer force of will to magically propel your own abilities. When making an attack roll or ability check, you roll an additional d20. You can choose to do so before or after you roll the die, but before the outcome is determined. You choose which of the d20s is used for the attack roll or ability check.

spell.name: Kiman's Native Ward
entries: Choose one of the following creature types: dragons, giants, monstrosities or oozes. Until the spell ends you are protected against that creature type. You can choose one of the following effects when you cast this spell. As an action on your turn, you can repeat the same effect or choose the other one.

items.name: Resilient
items.entry: You have advantage on saving throws against effects from creatures of the chosen type.

items.name: Dodge
items.entry: As a bonus action you can take the Dodge action. The effects only apply against creatures of the chosen type.

spell.name: Kiman's Saving Grace

time.condition: which you take when you fail a saving throw as a result of an attack that only you are targeted by

entries: A purple-hued barrier of magical force appears and protects you. You have a +3 bonus to the saving throw of the triggering attack.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the bonus increases by 1 for every two slot levels above 1st.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Small or Medium (your choice).

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

entries.name: Psychic Resilience
entries: You have resistance to psychic damage.

entries.name: Strong Mind
entries: Your innate psychic defenses grant you advantage on Intelligence saving throws.

entries.name: Illithid Spellcasting
entries: You know the {@spell mind sliver|tce} cantrip.
Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell charm person} spell with this trait.

Starting at 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell detect thoughts} spell with it. Once you cast {@spell charm person} or {@spell detect thoughts} spell with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait (choose when you select this race). None of these spells require spell components when you cast them with this trait.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Small or Medium (your choice).

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Near Death Experience
entries: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Ki Attack
entries: You know the {@spell ki blast|kea} cantrip. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for it.

entries.name: Flight
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can use your bonus action to charge your body with a burst of energy that lasts for 1 minute. For the duration, you gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed and can hover. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Small or Medium (your choice).

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

entries.name: Trance
entries: Volodni don't need to sleep. Instead, they meditate deeply, remaining semiconscious, for 4 hours a day. (The Common word for such meditation is 'trance') While meditating, you can dream after a fashion; such dreams are actually mental exercises that have become reflexive through years of practice. After resting in this way, you gain the same benefit that a human does from 8 hours of sleep.

entries.name: Plant Ancestry
entries: You have advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the poisoned condition on yourself. You also have resistance to poison damage. In addition, magic can't put you to sleep.

entries.name: Wild Camouflage
entries: You have advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks to hide in wooded terrain.

entries.name: Speech of Leaf
entries: You have the ability to communicate in a limited manner with plants. They can understand the meaning of your words, though you have no special ability to understand them in return. You have advantage on all Charisma checks you make to influence them.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Attendant casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 22}):

trait.name: Enigmatic Mind
entries: The Attendant's mind can't be read, creatures can communicate telepathically with the Attendant only if it allows, and magic can't determine whether the Attendant is lying.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the Attendant fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The Attendant doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Attendant makes two Force Strike attacks. It can also use Gravity Shift, if available.

action.name: Force Strike
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 15 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d10 + 8}) force damage, and the target is pulled up to 10 feet toward the Attendant or pushed 10 feet away from it, as the Attendant chooses.

action.name: Gravity Shift {@recharge 5}
entries: The Attendant reverses gravity for one creature it can see within 100 feet of itself. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 22} Wisdom saving throw or fall 100 feet upward. If the falling creature encounters a solid object (such as a ceiling) in this fall, it strikes the object just as it would during a downward fall. If the creature reaches the top of the area without striking anything, it hovers there until the start of the Attendant's next turn, at which time gravity returns to normal and the creature falls.

action.name: Teleport
entries: The Attendant teleports to an unoccupied space that it can see within 120 feet of itself.

reaction.name: Spell Mimicry (1/Day)
entries: Immediately after a creature the Attendant can see casts a spell of 5th level or lower, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 22} Charisma saving throw, or the Attendant immediately casts the same spell at the same level ({@hit 14} to hit with spell attacks, spell save {@dc 22}), requiring no material components and choosing the spell's targets.

legendary.name: Strike
entries: The Attendant makes one Force Strike attack.

legendary.name: Teleport
entries: The Attendant uses {@spell teleport}.

legendary.name: Unravel Magic (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Attendant targets one creature it can see within 120 feet of itself. The target must succeed on a {@dc 22} Constitution saving throw or take 35 ({@damage 10d6}) force damage, and each spell of 5th level or lower on the target ends.

bonus.name: Nimble Escape
entries: Knuttsak can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the Registrar remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal tree.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The Registrar deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Registrar makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 60/180 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 4d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Animate Trees (1/Day)
entries: The Registrar magically animates one or two trees it can see within 60 feet of it. These trees have the same statistics as a {@creature treant}, except they have Intelligence and Charisma scores of 1, they can't speak, and they have only the Slam action option. An animated tree acts as an ally of the Registrar. The tree remains animate for 1 day or until it dies; until the Registrar dies or is more than 120 feet from the tree; or until the Registrar takes a bonus action to turn it back into an inanimate tree. The tree then takes root if possible.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Owl Pacino casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 14}):

trait.name: Transmuter's Stone
entries: Owl Pacino carries a magic stone it crafted. The stone grants it one of the following benefits while bearing the stone; Owl Pacino chooses the benefit at the end of each long rest:

items.name: Darkvision
items.entry: Owl Pacino has {@sense darkvision} out to a range of 60 feet.

items.name: Resilience
items.entry: Owl Pacino has proficiency in Constitution saving throws.

items.name: Resistance
items.entry: Resistance. Owl Pacino has resistance to acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage (Owl Pacino's choice whenever choosing this benefit).

items.name: Speed
items.entry: Owl Pacino's walking speed is increased by 10 feet.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Owl Pacino makes three Arcane Burst attacks.

action.name: Arcane Burst
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d10 + 3}) acid damage.

bonus.name: Transmute {@recharge 4}
entries: Owl Pacino casts {@spell alter self} or changes the benefit of Transmuter's Stone if bearing the stone.

bonus.name: Nimble Escape
entries: Sobbing Steve can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of his turns.

trait.name: Dimensional Form
entries: The living magic can enter another creature’s space and vice versa, and it can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Extradimensional Chamber
entries: When the living magic enters another creature’s space (or vice versa) for the first time on turn, the other creature must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw or be pulled into the living magic’s extra -dimensional space, an unfurnished stone chamber 30 feet in every dimension. A creature too big to fit in this space succeeds on the saving throw automatically.

Creatures in the chamber never run out of breathable air. Magic that enables transit between planes, such as plane shift, can be used to escape the chamber, which has no exits otherwise. Creatures trapped inside the extradimensional chamber can’t see, target or deal damage to the living magic; however they can damage the room around them. Each 5-foot-square section of the ceiling, wall and floor in the chamber has AC 17, 50 hit points, immunity to poison and psychic damage, and immunity to bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage that is non magical.
If any section is reduced to 0 hit points the living magic and its chamber are destroyed.

When destroyed, the contents of the living magic’s extradimensional chamber are expelled, appearing as close to the living magic’s previous location as possible. Each expelled creature appears in a randomly determined unoccupied space, along with whatever it is wearing or carrying.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The living magic has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Crush
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 1} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 ({@damage 1d4 - 1}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: Mr. Floyd can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

bonus.name: Shadow Stealth
entries: While in dim light or darkness, Mr. Floyd takes the Hide action.

monster.name: Large Luigi

trait.name: Antimagic Cone
entries: Large Luigi central eye creates an area of antimagic, as in the {@spell antimagic field} spell, in a 150-foot cone. At the start of each of its turns, Large Luigi decides which way the cone faces and whether the cone is active. The area works against the Large Luigi's own eye rays.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Eye Rays
entries: Large Luigi shoots three of the following magical eye rays at random (reroll duplicates), choosing one to three targets it can see within 120 feet of it:

items.name: 1. Charm Ray
items.entry: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by Large Luigi for 1 hour, or until Large Luigi harms the creature.

items.name: 2. Paralyzing Ray
items.entry: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

items.name: 3. Fear Ray
items.entry: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

items.name: 4. Slowing Ray
items.entry: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target's speed is halved for 1 minute. In addition, the creature can't take reactions, and it can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

items.name: 5. Enervation Ray
items.entry: The targeted creature must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, taking 36 ({@damage 8d8}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: 6. Telekinetic Ray
entries: If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or Large Luigi moves it up to 30 feet in any direction. It is {@condition restrained} by the ray's telekinetic grip until the start of Large Luigi's next turn or until Large Luigi is {@condition incapacitated}.

If the target is an object weighing 300 pounds or less that isn't being worn or carried, it is moved up to 30 feet in any direction. Large Luigi can also exert fine control on objects with this ray, such as manipulating a simple tool or opening a door or a container.

items.name: 7. Sleep Ray
items.entry: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or fall asleep and remain {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute. The target awakens if it takes damage or another creature takes an action to wake it. This ray has no effect on constructs and undead.

items.name: 8. Petrification Ray
items.entry: The targeted creature must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature begins to turn to stone and is {@condition restrained}. It must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is {@condition petrified} until freed by the  {@spell greater restoration} spell or other magic.

items.name: 9. Disintegration Ray
entries: If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or take 45 ({@damage 10d8}) force damage. If this damage reduces the creature to 0 hit points, its body becomes a pile of fine gray dust.

If the target is a Large or smaller nonmagical object or creation of magical force, it is disintegrated without a saving throw. If the target is a Huge or larger object or creation of magical force, this ray disintegrates a 10-foot cube of it.

items.name: 10. Death Ray
items.entry: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or take 55 ({@damage 10d10}) necrotic damage. The target dies if the ray reduces it to 0 hit points.

legendaryHeader: Large Luigi can take 3 legendary actions, using the Eye Ray option below. It can take only one legendary action at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Large Luigi regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Eye Ray
entries: Large Luigi uses one random eye ray.

trait.name: Campus Knowledge
entries: While at Eldritch Academy, Atlas can't become lost by magical or nonmagical means. Atlas also has advantage on ability checks made to locate creatures or objects at Strixhaven.

trait.name: Univocal Speech
entries: When Atlas speaks, any creature that knows at least one language and can hear Atlas understands what it says.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: Atlas doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

resist.note: (granted by the blast scepter, see "Special Equipment" below)

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Halaster casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as his spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 22}, {@hit 14} to hit with spell attacks):

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Halaster wears a robe of eyes that lets him see in all directions, gives him darkvision out to a range of 120 feet, grants advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight, and allows him to see {@condition invisible} creatures and objects, as well as into the Ethereal Plane, out to a range of 120 feet.

Halaster wields a blast scepter (a very rare magic item that requires attunement). It can be used as an arcane focus. Whoever is attuned to the blast scepter gains resistance to fire and lightning damage and can, as an action, use it to cast {@spell thunderwave} as a 4th-level spell (save {@dc 16}) without expending a spell slot.
Halaster also wears a horned ring (a very rare magic item that requires attunement), which allows an attuned wearer to ignore Undermountain's magical restrictions (see "Alterations to Magic").

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Halaster fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Halaster has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If Halaster dies in Undermountain, he revives after {@dice 1d10} days, with all his hit points and any missing body parts restored. His new body appears in a random safe location in Undermountain.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Halaster makes two Blasting Bolt attacks.

action.name: Blasting Bolt
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 5d6 + 8}) lightning damage, and if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 22} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by Halaster until the start of his next turn.

action.name: Blast Scepter
entries: Halaster uses his blast scepter to cast {@spell thunderwave} as a 4th-level spell. Each creature in a 15-foot cube originating from him must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@dice 5d8} thunder damage and is pushed 10 feet away. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed

reaction.name: Negate Spell (3/Day)
entries: When Halaster sees a creature within 60 feet of him casting a spell, he tries to interrupt it. If the creature is casting a spell using a spell slot of 8th level or lower, its spell fails and has no effect. If it is casting a 9th-level spell, it must succeed on a DC 22 Intelligence saving throw, or the spells fails and has no effect.

legendary.name: Cast Spell
entries: Halaster casts a spell of 3rd level or lower.

legendary.name: Spell Ward (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Halaster expends a spell slot of 4th level or lower and gains 5 temporary hit points per level of the slot.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Iggwilv casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 24}, {@hit 16} to hit with spell attacks):

trait.name: Boon of Immortality
entries: Iggwilv is immune to any effect that would age her, and she can't die from old age.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Iggwilv fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Iggwilv has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. (This trait is bestowed by her robe of the archmagi.)

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Iggwilv wears an {@item amulet of the planes} and a {@item robe of the archmagi}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Iggwilv makes two Bewitching Bolt attacks.

action.name: Bewitching Bolt
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 5d6 + 8}) lightning damage, and if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 22} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by Iggwilv until the start of her next turn.

action.name: Abyssal Rift {@recharge 5}
entries: Iggwilv opens a momentary Abyssal rift within 120 feet of her. The rift is a 20-foot-radius sphere. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 22} Constitution saving throw, taking 40 ({@damage 9d8}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. In addition, there is a 50 percent chance that 3 {@creature hezrou||hezrous} then appear in unoccupied spaces in the sphere. They act as Iggwilv's allies, take their turns immediately after hers, and can't summon other demons. They remain until they die or until Iggwilv dismisses them as an action.

bonus.name: Fey Step
entries: Iggwilv teleports, along with any equipment she is wearing or carrying, to an unoccupied space she can see within 30 feet of her.

reaction.name: Negate Spell (2/Day)
entries: When Iggwilv sees a creature within 60 feet of her casting a spell, she tries to interrupt it. If the creature is casting a spell using a spell slot of 8th level or lower, its spell fails and has no effect. If it is casting a 9th-level spell, it must succeed on a {@dc 22} Intelligence saving throw, or the spells fails and has no effect.

legendary.name: Witchcraft
entries: Iggwilv uses Spellcasting or Fey Step.

legendary.name: Dark Speech (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Iggwilv utters a phrase in a forbidden language and targets one or two creatures she can see within 60 feet of her. Each target must succeed on a {@dc 22} Wisdom saving throw or take 11 ({@damage 2d10}) psychic damage and be {@condition frightened} of Iggwilv for 1 minute. A target can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success and thereby becoming immune to Iggwilv's Dark Speech for 24 hours.

legendary.name: Fey Beguilement (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Iggwilv targets one creature she can see within 60 feet of her. The target must succeed on a {@dc 22} Charisma saving throw or be possessed by a fey spirit. While possessed, the target must obey Iggwilv's commands. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, banishing the fey spirit and ending the effect on itself on a success.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The chwinga's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom. It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material or verbal components:

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The chwinga doesn't require air, food, or drink. When it dies, it turns into a handful of flower petals, a cloud of pollen, a stone statuette resembling its former self, a tiny sphere of smooth stone, or a puddle of fresh water (your choice).

trait.name: Evasion
entries: When the chwinga is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

action.name: Magical Gift (1/Day)
entries: The chwinga targets a humanoid it can see within 5 feet of it. The target gains a {@filter supernatural charm|rewards|type=charm} of the DM's choice. See {@book chapter 7|DMG|7|Other Rewards} of the Dungeon Masters Guide for more information on supernatural charms.

action.name: Natural Shelter
entries: The chwinga magically takes shelter inside a rock, a living plant, or a natural source of fresh water in its space. The chwinga can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect while inside this shelter, and the shelter doesn't impair the chwinga's blindsight. The chwinga can use its action to emerge from a shelter. If its shelter is destroyed, the chwinga is forced out and appears in the shelter's space, but is otherwise unharmed.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: Teioh has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the Teioh's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Pounce
entries: If the Teioh moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 11} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the Teioh can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Teioh makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Joe Mummah casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 13}):

bonus.name: Demotivate (2/Day)
entries: Joe Mummah hurls magical insults at one creature it can see within 30 feet of itself. The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of Joe Mummah for 1 minute. While {@condition frightened} in this way, the target can't take reactions, its speed is halved, and any hit Joe Mummah scores against the creature is a critical hit. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

reaction.name: Rousing Verse
entries: When a creature Joe Mummah can see within 30 feet of it fails a saving throw, Joe Mummah magically weaves together stirring prose, allowing the creature to reroll the saving throw and use the higher result.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Dimik casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Dimik has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Dimik makes two Grasping Limb attacks.

action.name: Grasping Limb
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}). The Dimik can have no more than two targets {@condition grappled} at a time.

trait.name: Pounce
entries: If the riding allosaurus moves at least 30 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the riding allosaurus can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Pounce
entries: If the combat deinonychus moves at least 30 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the combat deinonychus can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Trampling Charge
entries: If the young triceratops moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the younh triceratops can make one stomp attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Stomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one {@condition prone} creature. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage. If the target is a Small or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the young tyrannosaurus can't bite another target.

trait.name: Earth Glide
entries: Dwayne can burrow through non magical, unworked earth and stone. While doing so, Dwayne doesn't disturb the material it moves through.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: Beowulf doesn't need to breathe.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: Floyd can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: Colt can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: Lily has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: As a conduit of the magical weave, you can cast arcane spells.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: At 1st level, you know four cantrips of your choice from the {@filter mage spell list|spells|class=mage}, {@filter sorcerer spell list|spells|class=sorcerer}, {@filter warlock spell list|spells|class=warlock} or {@filter wizard spell list|spells|class=wizard}. You learn additional cantrips of your choice at higher levels, as shown in the Cantrips Known column of the Mage table.

entries.name: Preparing and Casting Spells
entries: The Mage uses Magic Points instead of spell slots to fuel spells. Each spell has a point cost based on its level.
To create a spell slot of a given spell’s level, you must expend a number of Magic Points equal to the spell’s level. Cantrips don’t require slots and therefore don’t require Magic Points.
Instead of gaining a number of spell slots to cast your spells from the Spellcasting feature, you gain a pool of Magic Points instead.

You expend a number of Magic Points to create a spell slot of a given level, and then use that slot to cast a spell. You can’t reduce your Magic Point total to less than 0, and you regain all spent Magic Points when you finish a long rest.

Spells of 6th level and higher are particularly taxing to cast. You can use Magic Points to create one slot of each level of 6th or higher. You can’t create another slot of the same level until you finish a long rest.

The number of Magic Points you have to spend is based on your level as a spellcaster, as shown in the Mage table. Your level also determines the maximum-level spell slot you can create. Even though you might have enough points to create a slot above this maximum, you can’t do so.

You prepare the list of spells that are available for you to cast, choosing from the {@filter mage spell list|spells|class=mage}, {@filter sorcerer spell list|spells|class=sorcerer}, {@filter warlock spell list|spells|class=warlock} or {@filter wizard spell list|spells|class=wizard}. When you do so, choose a number of spells equal to your Wisdom modifier + your Mage level (minimum of one spell). The spells must be of a level for which you can cast.

You can change your list of prepared spells when you finish a long rest. Preparing a new list of spells requires time spent in meditating and accessing the weave: at least 1 minute per spell level for each spell on your list.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for your Mage spells. The power of your spells draws upon your devotion and attunement to the magical weave.

You use your Wisdom whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Wisdom modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

entries.name: Ritual Casting
entries: You can cast a Mage spell as a ritual if that spell has the ritual tag and you have the spell prepared.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use an {@item amulet|phb}, a {@item crystal|phb}, an {@item emblem|phb}, a {@item reliquary|phb}, an {@item orb|phb} or a {@item totem|phb} as a spellcasting focus for your spells.

classFeature.name: Magical Specialization
entries: Choose a magical specialization, shaping your practice of magic into a unique manifestation of your power.
Your choice grants you features when you choose it at 1st level and again at 6th, 10th, and 14th level.

classFeature.name: Metamagic Points
entries: You have 1 Metamagic Point as shown in the Mage table. You can never have more Metamagic Points than shown on the table for your level. You regain all spent Metamagic Points when you finish a long rest.

classFeature.name: Flexible Casting
entries: You can use your metamagic points to gain additional magic points, or sacrifice magic points to gain additional metamagic points.

entries.name: Creating Magic Points
entries: As a bonus action on your turn, you can expend metamagic points and gain a number of magic points equal to the metamagic points expended. Any magic points you create with this feature vanishes when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Converting Magic Points to Metamagic Points
entries: As a bonus action on your turn, you can expend magic points and gain a number of metamagic points equal to the magic points expended.

classFeature.name: Font of Magic
entries: At 2nd level, you tap into a deep wellspring of magic within yourself. This wellspring is represented by metamagic points, which allow you to create a variety of magical effects.

classFeature.name: Metamagic
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you can use your innate spark of magic to create your own specialized versions of the spells you cast. You learn two {@filter Metamagic Options|optionalfeatures|Source=KEA|Feature Type=MM} of your choice. You can use only one Metamagic option on a spell when you cast it, unless otherwise noted.

At the end of a long rest, you can choose to replace one of your Metamagic options with another of your choice. You learn an additional Metamagic option of your choice at 5th, 9th, 13th, and 17th levels.

classFeature.name: Cantrip Formulas
entries: At 3rd level, whenever you finish a long rest, you can replace one cantrip you know with another cantrip.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
Instead of ability score increases, you may take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Metamagic Utility
entries: {@i 4th-level feature (enhances Ability Score Improvement)}

When you reach a level in this class that grants the Ability Score Improvement feature, you can replace one of the options you chose for the Metamagic feature with a different Metamagic option available to you.

classFeature.name: Magical Specialization Feature
entries: At 6th level, you gain a feature granted by your Magical Specialization.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Metamagic Utility
entries: {@i 8th-level feature (enhances Ability Score Improvement)}

When you reach a level in this class that grants the Ability Score Improvement feature, you can replace one of the options you chose for the Metamagic feature with a different Metamagic option available to you.

classFeature.name: Metamagic
entries: You gain an additional Metamagic option of your choice.

classFeature.name: Magical Specialization Feature
entries: At 10th level, you gain a feature granted by your Magical Specialization.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Metamagic Utility
entries: {@i 12th-level feature (enhances Ability Score Improvement)}

When you reach a level in this class that grants the Ability Score Improvement feature, you can replace one of the options you chose for the Metamagic feature with a different Metamagic option available to you.

classFeature.name: Magical Specialization Feature
entries: At 14th level, you gain a feature granted by your Magical Specialization.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Metamagic Utility
entries: {@i 16th-level feature (enhances Ability Score Improvement)}

When you reach a level in this class that grants the Ability Score Improvement feature, you can replace one of the options you chose for the Metamagic feature with a different Metamagic option available to you.

classFeature.name: Metamagic
entries: You gain an additional Metamagic option of your choice.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Metamagic Utility
entries: {@i 19th-level feature (enhances Ability Score Improvement)}

When you reach a level in this class that grants the Ability Score Improvement feature, you can replace one of the options you chose for the Metamagic feature with a different Metamagic option available to you.

classFeature.name: Coven Magic
entries: At 1st level, you have joined a coven of hags and witches.
Your coven has exposed you to special techniques and been bestowed with magical prowess which has given you facility with spells.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: You know four cantrips of your choice from the {@filter warlock spell list|spells|class=warlock} and {@filter witch spell list|spells|class=witch}. You learn additional cantrips of your choice at higher levels, as shown in the Cantrips Known column of the Witch table.

entries.name: Wicca Points
entries: The Witch uses Wicca Points instead of spell slots to fuel spells. Each spell has a point cost based on its level.
To create a spell slot of a given spell’s level, you must expend a number of Wicca Points equal to the spell’s level. Cantrips don’t require slots and therefore don’t require Wicca Points.
Instead of gaining a number of spell slots to cast your spells from the Coven Magic feature, you gain a pool of Wicca Points instead.

You expend a number of Wicca Points to create a spell slot of a given level, and then use that slot to cast a spell. You can’t reduce your Magic Point total to less than 0, and you regain all spent Wicca Points when you finish a long rest.

Spells of 6th level and higher are particularly taxing to cast. You can use Wicca Points to create one slot of each level of 6th or higher. You can’t create another slot of the same level until you finish a long rest.

The number of Wicca Points you have to spend is based on your level as a spellcaster, as shown in the Witch table. Your level also determines the maximum-level spell slot you can create. Even though you might have enough points to create a slot above this maximum, you can’t do so.

entries.name: Spells Known of 1st Level And Higher
entries: At 1st level, you know two 1st-level spells of your choice from the {@filter warlock spell list|spells|class=warlock} and {@filter witch spell list|spells|class=witch}.

The Spells Known column of the Witch table shows when you learn more spells of your choice. Each of these spells must be of a level as shown in the Max Spell Level column of the Witch table. For instance, when you reach 3rd level in this class, you can learn one new spell of 1st or 2nd level.

Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the Witch spells you know and replace it with another spell from the {@filter warlock spell list|spells|class=warlock} and {@filter witch spell list|spells|class=witch}, which also must be of a level as shown in the Max Spell Level column of the Witch table.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Charisma is your spellcasting ability for your Witch spells, so you use your Charisma whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Charisma modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a Witch spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use an arcane focus as a spellcasting focus for your Witch spells.

classFeature.name: Duplicitous
entries: At 1st level, you have learned how to adopt some innate supernatural abilities of hags.
You can mimic animal sounds and humanoid voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful DC 14 Wisdom (Insight) check.
You also know the @spell[Disguise Self] spell. The spell doesn't count against your number of spells known.

classFeature.name: Horrific Appearance
entries: Starting at 1st level, you manifest an aspect of your coven’s dreadful power. As a bonus action, you transform into the horrifying visage of a hag for 1 minute. You gain the following benefits while transformed:

items.entry: Once during each of your turns, when you hit a creature with a spell, you can force it to make a Wisdom saving throw, and if the saving throw fails, the target is frightened of you until the end of your next turn.
You gain temporary hit points equal to 1d10 + your Witch level.
You are immune to the frightened condition.

entries: You can transform a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

classFeature.name: Hag's Sight
entries: At 2nd level, You can see normally in darkness, both magical and non-magical, to a distance of 120 feet.

classFeature.name: Hocus Pocus
entries: Starting at 2nd level, You know the Hex spell. The spell doesn't count against your number of spells known.

As a bonus action, you bewitch a creature cursed by your Hex spell. When you do so, the creature must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or use its reaction to move up to 30 feet in a direction of your choice. To use this ability, you must be able to see the cursed target, and it must be within 30 feet of you.

classFeature.name: Invisible Passage
entries: At 3rd level, you can magically turn invisible until you make an attack, cast a spell, or until your concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). While invisible, you leave no physical evidence of your passage, so you can be tracked only by magic. Any equipment you wear or carry is invisible with you. Once you use this feature, you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest or expend 2 Wicca Points.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Graystaff Magic
entries: At 5th level, Your coven bestows unto you a graystaff, a length of gray wood that is a focus for your inner power. This wooden broom, which weighs 3 pounds, functions like a mundane broom until you stand astride it and speak its command word (decided by you). It then hovers beneath you and can be ridden in the air.
It has a flying speed of 50 feet. It can carry up to 400 pounds, but its flying speed becomes 30 feet while carrying over 200 pounds. The broom stops hovering when you land.

You can send the broom to travel alone to a destination within 1 mile of you if you speak the command word, name the location, and are familiar with that place. The broom comes back to you when you speak another command word, provided that the broom is still within 1 mile of you.
If the staff is lost or destroyed, you can craft another, which takes a day. Only you can use the graystaff.

classFeature.name: Crone's Blessing
entries: Starting at 6th level, you can vanish in a puff of mist in response to harm. When you take damage, you can magically teleport along with any equipment you are wearing or carrying up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. Until the start of your next turn, you appear ghostly and gain resistance to all damage, including the triggering attack.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

classFeature.name: Hag's Eye
entries: At 7th level, your coven crafts a magic item called a hag eye, which is made from a real eye coated in varnish and often fitted to a pendant or other wearable item. You can take an action to see what the hag eye sees if the hag eye is on the same plane of existence. A hag eye has AC 10, 1 hit point, and darkvision with a radius of 60 feet. If it is destroyed, you take 3d10 psychic damage and you are blinded for 24 hours.

You can only have one hag eye at a time, and creating a new one requires your coven to perform a ritual. The ritual takes 1 hour, and you can't perform it while blinded. During the ritual, if you take any action other than performing the ritual, you must start over.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Exorcism
entries: Starting at 9th level, as an action, one creature you can see within 60 feet of you must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or take 5d10 force damage and be banished to a prison demiplane. While there, the target is incapacitated and it remains there for 1 minute or until your concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell), at which point the target reappears in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied. Once you use this feature, you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest or expend 5 Wicca Points.

classFeature.name: Witchcraft Defenses
entries: Beginning at 10th level, your coven teaches you how to turn the mind-affecting magic of your enemies against them. You are immune to being charmed, and when another creature attempts to charm you, you can use your reaction to attempt to turn the charm back on that creature. The creature must succeed on a Charisma saving throw against your spell save DC or be charmed by you for 1 minute or until the creature takes any damage.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Coven's Cauldron
entries: At 12th level, your coven bestows unto you a magical cauldron. The cauldron can be used in the following ways:

items.entry: If wine is poured into the cauldron and stirred for 10 minutes, it transforms into a magical elixir that fortifies up to four people per gallon of wine used. Any creature that imbibes the elixir gains 10 temporary hit points. Any of the elixir that isn't consumed within 1 hour vanishes. Once used, this property of the cauldron can't be used again until the next dawn.

If water is poured into the cauldron and stirred for 1 minute, it transforms into a hearty, hot stew that provides one nourishing meal for up to four people per gallon of water used. The stew remains hot while in the cauldron, then cools naturally after it is removed. The outside of the cauldron remains safe to touch despite the heat of the stew. Once used, this property of the cauldron can't be used again until the next dawn.

When the cauldron is filled with 90 gallons of water mixed with 10 gallons of wine, it can be used as the focus for a scrying spell. When this spell is cast using the cauldron as its focus, the target of the spell fails its saving throw automatically, and the spell works even if its caster and the target are on different planes of existence. When the spell ends, all the liquid in the cauldron vanishes. Once used, this property of the cauldron can't be used again until 7 days have passed.

You can use an action to scream into the empty cauldron, which magically summons a swarm of bats that flies out of the cauldron and acts immediately after you in the initiative order. The swarm obeys your commands and disappears after 1 minute if it hasn't been destroyed by then. Once used, this property of the cauldron can't be used again until the next dawn.

entries: If the cauldron is lost or destroyed, you can craft another, which takes 10 days. Only you can use the cauldron.

classFeature.name: Spell Resistance
entries: Starting at 14th level, you have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

classFeature.name: Bewitched
entries: At 15th level, as an action you can target one creature you can see within 60 feet of you. The target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be possessed by a fey spirit. While possessed, the target must obey your commands. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, banishing the fey spirit and ending the effect on itself on a success.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Master of Forms
entries: Beginning at 18th level, You also know the @spell[True Polymorph] spell. The spell doesn't count against your number of spells known.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Boon of Immortality
entries: At 20th level, you are immune to any effect that would age you, and you can't die from old age.

classFeature.name: Manifesting
entries: As a student of psionics, you can master and use psionic energy. Psionics is a special form of magic use.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: At 1st level, you know four cantrips of your choice from the {@filter psion spell list|spells|class=psion} or {@filter sorcerer spell list|spells|class=sorcerer}. You learn additional cantrips of your choice at higher levels. As shown in the Cantrips Known column.

entries.name: Manifesting Powers
entries: The Psion uses power points to fuel spells. Each spell has a point cost based on its level.
The number of Power Points required to manifest a spell is equal to its level. Cantrips don’t require power points.

You gain a reservoir of power points from the Manifesting feature. You expend a number of power points to create a spell of a given level, and then manifest a spell. You can’t reduce your power point total to less than 0, and you regain all spent power points when you finish a long rest.

Spells of 6th level and higher are particularly taxing to manifest. You can use power points to create one spell of each level of 6th or higher. You can’t create another spell of the same level until you finish a long rest.

The number of power points you have to spend is based on your level as a manifester, as shown in the Psion table. Your level also determines the maximum-level power you can create. Even though you might have enough points to create a power above this maximum, you can’t do so.

entries.name: Augmenting Powers
entries: Though you have access to a potent amount of psionic energy, it takes training and practice to channel that energy.

To cast a spell at higher levels, you must expend a number of Power Points equal to the spells level to do so. When casting a spell, you cannot spend more power points than equal to half your psion level (rounded up).
For example, as an 11th-level psion, you can spend no more than 6 power points on a spell at one time, no matter how many power points you have.

entries.name: Manifesting Ability
entries: Intelligence is your manifesting ability for your psion spells, since you learn your spells through dedicated study and memorization. You use your Intelligence whenever a spell refers to your manifesting ability.
In addition, you use your Intelligence modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a psion spell you manifest and when making an attack roll with one.

entries.name: Learning Spells of 1st Level or Higher
entries: You know two 1st-level spells of your choice from the psion or sorcerer spell lists.

The Spells Known column of the Psion table shows when you learn more psion spells of your choice. Each of these spells must be of a level as shown in the Max Spell Level column of the Psion table. For instance, when you reach 3rd level in this class, you can learn one new spell of 1st or 2nd level.

Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the psion spells you know and replace it with another spell from the sorcerer or psion spell lists, which also must be of a level as shown in the Max Spell Level column of the Psion table.

classFeature.name: Discipline
entries: Choose a psionic discipline, shaping your practice of psionics into a unique manifestation of your power.

classFeature.name: Metapsionic Points
entries: You have 2 Metapsionic Points as shown in the psion table. You can never have more Metapsionic Points than shown on the table for your level. You regain all spent Metapsionic Points when you finish a long rest.

classFeature.name: Psionic Reservoir
entries: At 2nd level, you can use your metapsionic points to gain additional power points, or sacrifice power points to gain additional metapsionic points. You learn other ways to use your metapsionic points as you reach higher levels.

entries.name: Creating Power Points
entries: As a bonus action on your turn, you can expend metapsionic points and gain a number of power points equal to twice the metapsionic points expended. Any power points you create with this feature vanishes when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Converting Power Points to Metapsionic Points
entries: As a bonus action on your turn, you can expend power points and gain a number of metapsionic points equal to the power points expended.

classFeature.name: Metapsionic
entries: When you reach a level in this class that grants the Ability Score Improvement feature, you can do one of the following, representing the magic within you flowing in new ways:

items.entry: Replace one of the options you chose for the Metapsionic feature with a different Metapsionic option available to you.
Replace one cantrip you learned from this class' manifesting feature with another cantrip from the sorcerer or psion spell lists.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
Instead of ability score increases, you may take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Metapsionic Utility
entries: {@i 4th-level feature (enhances Ability Score Improvement)}

When you reach a level in this class that grants the Ability Score Improvement feature, you can replace one of the options you chose for the Metapsionic feature with a different Metapsionic option available to you.

classFeature.name: Psionic Guidance
entries: When you reach 5th level, you can tap into your inner wellspring of psionics to try and conjure success from failure. When you make an ability check that fails, you can spend 1 metapsionic point to reroll the d20, and you must use the new roll, potentially turning the failure into a success.

classFeature.name: Discipline Feature
entries: At 6th level, you gain a feature granted by your Psionic Discipline.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Metapsionic Utility
entries: {@i 8th-level feature (enhances Ability Score Improvement)}

When you reach a level in this class that grants the Ability Score Improvement feature, you can replace one of the options you chose for the Metapsionic feature with a different Metapsionic option available to you.

classFeature.name: Metapsionic
entries: You gain an additional Metapsionic option of your choice.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Metapsionic Utility
entries: {@i 12th-level feature (enhances Ability Score Improvement)}

When you reach a level in this class that grants the Ability Score Improvement feature, you can replace one of the options you chose for the Metapsionic feature with a different Metapsionic option available to you.

classFeature.name: Discipline Feature
entries: At 14th level, you gain a feature granted by your Psionic Discipline.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Metapsionic Utility
entries: {@i 16th-level feature (enhances Ability Score Improvement)}

When you reach a level in this class that grants the Ability Score Improvement feature, you can replace one of the options you chose for the Metapsionic feature with a different Metapsionic option available to you.

classFeature.name: Metapsionic
entries: You gain an additional Metapsionic option of your choice.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Metapsionic Utility
entries: {@i 19th-level feature (enhances Ability Score Improvement)}

When you reach a level in this class that grants the Ability Score Improvement feature, you can replace one of the options you chose for the Metapsionic feature with a different Metapsionic option available to you.

classFeature.name: Psionic Restoration
entries: At 20th level, you regain 4 expended metapsionic points whenever you finish a short rest.

classFeature.name: Blue Magic
entries: Hermetic don't wield magic in the same way that other spellcasters do.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: You know four cantrips of your choice from any class’s spell list. You learn additional cantrips of your choice at higher levels, as shown in the Cantrips Known column of the Hermetic table.

entries.name: Lancet
entries: Instead of learning spells, they use magic to copy another creature's special abilities.

At 1st level, a Hermetic can copy a creature's abilities. A Hermetic can only copy abilities from creatures that have a CR equal to or less than their Hermetic class level. In addition, they cannot copy an ability from a creature if it is a melee weapon attack, ranged weapon attack, multiattack or a spell.

entries.name: Mimics Known
entries: When finishing a short or long rest, a Hermetic can retain one of the abilities they have copied as a mimic. If they already know the maximum number of mimics as shown in the Mimics Known column of the Hermetic table, they can instead replace one mimic they already have with one they have copied.

entries.name: Using Mimics
entries: The Hermetic uses mana points to fuel their mimics. Each mimic costs one mana point. The Hermetic gains a reservoir of mana points from the Blue Magic feature. The Hermetic cannot reduce their mana point total to less than 0, and they regain all spent mana points when they finish a short or long rest.
All mimics have verbal and somatic components when used. If a mimic has a duration longer than 1 round, once used the Hermetic must maintain concentration on it, as if they were casting a spell.

Where a mimic has copied an action that has multiple options, such as a beholder’s Eye Rays; they only copy one of the attacks, like Charm Ray. In addition, where a mimic has copied an action that has multiple attacks, such as a beholder’s Eye Rays; they can only perform one attack.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Constitution is a Hermetic’s ability for using mimics. They use their Constitution  modifier when setting the saving throw DC for mimics they use and when making an attack roll with one.

entries.name: Lancet
entries: The Lancet ability can be used in the following ways:

entries.name: Imitate
entries: A Hermetic can ready an action to copy another creature's abilities. If readying an action in this way, when a Hermetic can see a hostile creature undertake an action, bonus action, or reaction; the Hermetic can attempt to copy the ability. The creature's ability must not target or affect the Hermetic.

entries.name: Copy
entries: As a reaction, when a Hermetic can see a hostile creature undertake an action, bonus action, or reaction; the Hermetic can attempt to copy the ability. The Hermetic must be directly targetted or affected by the creature’s ability.

entries.name: Examine
entries: If a Hermetic spends at least 1 minute examining a creature with at least 1 hit point; the Hermetic can attempt to copy one of the creature’s abilities (randomly determined by the DM).

entries.name: Consume
entries: As a bonus action, when a Hermetic slays a creature; the Hermetic can attempt to copy one of the creature’s abilities (randomly determined by the DM) by consuming part of the creature.
In order to copy a creature’s special ability, the Hermetic must succeed on an Constitution ability check DC 12 + the creature’s challenge rating.
Each time a Hermetic fails to copy a creature’s ability; when they attempt again, to copy the same ability, they do so with a cumulative +1 bonus to their Constitution check.

On success, the Hermetic can use the copied ability, as if it were a known mimic until they finish short or long rest. A Hermetic can only retain a number of copied abilities equal to their proficiency bonus. All copied abilities not retained as mimics during a short or long rest are forgotten when the Hermetic finishes resting.

classFeature.name: Midnite Warrior
entries: At 1st level, when attacking with one of the following weapons, you can use your Constitution modifier, instead of Strength or Dexterity, for the attack and damage rolls: longsword, rapier, scimitar, shortsword, spear, trident, whip.

classFeature.name: Enemy Skill
entries: At 2nd level, a Hermetic takes on aspects of the creatures it has copied abilities from. When a Hermetic retains a mimic, they can choose to express that power not only through their magic but various cosmetic changes, such as:

items.entry: If they copy the Whirlwind ability from an Air Elemental, they may give themself an aura that generates a harmless breeze, billowing a worn cape;
If they copy the Invisibility ability from an Imp, they may give themselves a constant smell of brimstone and sulfur;

entries: These effects cannot alter the Hermetic's appearance in such a way that could disguise or alter them. In addition, these effects cannot provide boons or changes to them that would aid them in combat or other encounters.

classFeature.name: Copycat
entries: At 3rd level, when a Hermetic fails an Constitution ability check to copy a creature’s ability, they can add a d4 to the roll, potentially turning the roll into a success. This benefit can be used a number of times equal to their proficiency bonus, and all expended uses are restored when they finish a long rest.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Azure Utility
entries: {@i 4th-level feature (enhances Ability Score Improvement)}

Whenever a Hermetic reaches a level in this class that grants the Ability Score Improvement feature, they can replace one cantrip they learned from this class's Blue Magic feature with another cantrip from any spell list.

classFeature.name: Sapphire Magic
entries: The Hermetic knows how to turn weaker abilities into magical formulas they can use with little effort. At 5th level, at the end of a short or long rest, the Hermetic can transform one mimic they know that was copied from a creature of challenge rating ½ or lower into a cantrip.

classFeature.name: Libra
entries: The Hermetic knows how to scan enemies and imitate their special features. At 6th level, as an action, the Hermetic can ascertain information about another creature as if they had cast the Kiman’s Metagaming spell. Once they use this feature, they can't do so again until they finish a short or long rest or expend a mana point.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Azure Utility
entries: {@i 8th-level feature (enhances Ability Score Improvement)}

Whenever a Hermetic reaches a level in this class that grants the Ability Score Improvement feature, they can replace one cantrip they learned from this class's Blue Magic feature with another cantrip from any spell list.

classFeature.name: Cobalt Lore
entries: Starting at 10th level, when using the Libra ability from this class, instead of rolling to determine what information they ascertain, a Hermetic can select which two characteristics. They can do this a number of times equal to their proficiency bonus, and all expended uses are restored when they finish a long rest.

classFeature.name: Sapphire Magic
entries: The Hermetic knows how to turn weaker abilities into magical formulas they can use with little effort. At 11th level, the challenge rating of the creature increases to 1.

classFeature.name: Legendary Learning
entries: At 11th level, the Hermetic can now imitate the most powerful of a creature's actions. In addition to copying a creature's actions, bonus action and reactions, they can now copy one legendary action. When they use this ability, they must finish a long rest before they can do so again.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
