If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Azure Utility
entries: {@i 12th-level feature (enhances Ability Score Improvement)}

Whenever a Hermetic reaches a level in this class that grants the Ability Score Improvement feature, they can replace one cantrip they learned from this class's Blue Magic feature with another cantrip from any spell list.

classFeature.name: Legendary Learning
entries: At 13th level you can copy another legendary action. Each new legendary action must be different from the others you know. You can still only use each legendary action once. You must finish a long rest before you can use each again.

classFeature.name: Monstrous Form
entries: Starting at 14th level, the Hermetic knows how to imitate the creature's innate features and characteristics. In addition to copying a creature's actions, bonus action, reactions and legendary actions, they can now copy one special trait or feature, such as Barbed Devil’s Magic Resistance.
Mimics that represent these abilities only last for 1 hour when used and the Hermetic must maintain concentration on them.

classFeature.name: Legendary Learning
entries: At 15th level you can copy another legendary action. Each new legendary action must be different from the others you know. You can still only use each legendary action once. You must finish a long rest before you can use each again.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Azure Utility
entries: {@i 16th-level feature (enhances Ability Score Improvement)}

Whenever a Hermetic reaches a level in this class that grants the Ability Score Improvement feature, they can replace one cantrip they learned from this class's Blue Magic feature with another cantrip from any spell list.

classFeature.name: Sapphire Magic
entries: The Hermetic knows how to turn weaker abilities into magical formulas they can use with little effort. At 17th level, the challenge rating of the creature increases to 2.

classFeature.name: Legendary Learning
entries: At 17th level you can copy another legendary action. Each new legendary action must be different from the others you know. You can still only use each legendary action once. You must finish a long rest before you can use each again.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Azure Utility
entries: {@i 19th-level feature (enhances Ability Score Improvement)}

Whenever a Hermetic reaches a level in this class that grants the Ability Score Improvement feature, they can replace one cantrip they learned from this class's Blue Magic feature with another cantrip from any spell list.

classFeature.name: Mana Master
entries: At 20th level, the Hermetic can draw on their inner reserve of mystical power to regain expended mana points. They can spend 1 minute to regain all their expended mana points from their Blue Magic feature. Once they regain mana points with this feature, they must finish a long rest before they can do so again.

subclassFeature.name: Aeromancer
entries: Harnessing the power of elemental air, the Aeromancer is a master of wind magic. Aeromancers use the element of air to both bolster their defenses, warding against harm and to use hurricane destructive magic to defeat their foes.

subclassFeature.name: Tempestuous Magic
entries: At 1st level, you can use a bonus action, immediately before or after you cast a spell of 1st level or higher to fly up to 15 feet without provoking opportunity attacks. If you are in the air at the end of this movement, you fall if nothing is holding you aloft.

subclassFeature.name: Blast of Air
entries: At 1st level, you can create a blast of compressed air that strikes like a mighty fist. As an action, you can expend a 1st level spell slot and choose a creature within 30 feet of you. That creature must make a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC.

On a failed save, the creature takes 2d10 thunder damage and you can push the creature up to 20 feet away from you and knock it prone. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage, and you don't push it or knock it prone. For every spell slot you expend higher than 1st the damage increases by 1d10.

subclassFeature.name: Defensive Gust
entries: At 6th level, As an action, you can conjure a strong wind (20 miles per hour) to blow around you in a 5-foot radius and it moves with you, remaining centered on you. It extinguishes unprotected flames in its area. It hedges out vapor, gas, and fog that can be dispersed by strong wind. Attack rolls of ranged weapon attacks against you have disadvantage. The strong wind lasts for 1 minute. You can use this a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Whirlwind Rebuke
entries: At 10th level, when you are hit by a melee attack, you can use your reaction to deal thunder damage to the attacker equal to your level. The attacker must also make a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, the attacker is pushed in a straight line up to 20 feet away from you in a direction of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Gone with the Wind
entries: At 14th level, you gain immunity to thunder damage.

subclassFeature.name: Apothecary
entries: As a master of brewing, mixing and alchemy, you have found that the power of magic lies within your own potion concoctions. Whether its through healing, empowering your allies or simply a vial of destruction; you have it all.

subclassFeature.name: Potion Apprentice
entries: At 1st level, you can see the true value of potions and have a knack for getting them at a fraction of the cost. Potions are sold to you at half price and cost half the usual price to craft.

subclassFeature.name: Chemical Trainee
entries: At 1st level, at the end of a long rest you can reproduce the effects of one magical common or one non magical potion in an empty vial, flask or similar container. Whether you use the potion or not, its properties disappear the next time you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Potion Adept
entries: At 6th level, when you consume a potion you can choose to double one numerical effect of one potion. For example, you could double the duration of a potion of acid resistance from 1 hour to 2 hours. Or you could increase the effects of a potion of healing to restore 4d8 + 4 hit points instead of 2d4 + 2. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Potion Savant
entries: At 10th level, at the end of a long rest, in addition to one magical common potion, you can also reproduce the effects of one magical uncommon potion in an empty vial, flask or similar container. Whether you use the potions or not, their properties disappear the next time you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Master Alchemist
entries: At 14th level, you have been exposed to so many chemicals that they pose little risk to you, and you can use them to quickly end certain ailments: You are immune to acid damage and poison damage, and you are now immune to the poisoned condition.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Armorer
entries: You believe that a best defense is the best offense. Contrary to convention and unlike other mages you guard yourself in both physical armor and the magical kind. Getting through all your defenses will be a tough ask of any foe.

subclassFeature.name: Armor Specialist
entries: At 1st level, you gain proficiency with all armor and shields. If the armor normally has a Strength requirement, the armor lacks this requirement for you. You can use armor as a spellcasting focus for your mage spells.

subclassFeature.name: Guarded Mage
entries: At 1st level, any armor you don attaches to you and can’t be removed against your will. It also expands to cover your entire body, although you can retract or deploy any section such as greaves or the helmet as a bonus action. The armor replaces any missing limbs, functioning identically to a body part it is replacing. You can doff or don the armor as an action. Also, you can use your spellcasting ability modifier instead of your dexterity for the bonus to your AC. This cannot exceed the maximum bonus granted by the armor as usual.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: At 6th level, you can attack twice, rather than once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn. If you are wearing a shield, you can also use a bonus action to try to shove a creature within 5 feet of you with your shield.

subclassFeature.name: Reactive Protection
entries: If you aren't incapacitated, as a reaction, when you are subjected to a spell or other harmful effect that requires you to make a saving throw, you can add your proficiency bonus to that roll. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus. You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Stalwart Defense
entries: You have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from non magical attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Archmage
entries: Archmages dont view the standard constraints of magic like other casters. Archmages push the boundaries of spells and casting, seeking to tap into the power of the weave, developing powerful and secret techniques bending the weave to their whim.

subclassFeature.name: Power Surge
entries: At 1st level, when you cast a spell, you can expend magic points to increase their effectiveness. For every two magic points you expend in addition to the magic points used to cast the spell, you can increase the spell save DC or your the spell by 1 or increase the bonus to your spell attack roll by 1. Regardless of the number of magic points you expend, it cannot exceed more than half your proficiency bonus (rounded down).

subclassFeature.name: Detect Spell
entries: At 1st level, your knowledge of spells exceeds others. When you can see another creature casting a spell, by expending 2 magic points, you can use your reaction to identify the name of the spell that has been cast.

subclassFeature.name: Spell Pool Manipulation
entries: At 6th level, When casting a spell, you can combine magic points and metamagic points to cast a spell. For example, you can expend 3 magic points and 2 metamagic points to cast a 3rd level spell.

subclassFeature.name: Reactive Caster
entries: At 10th level, when cast the spell @spell[counterspell], in addition to its normal effects, you can reflect the spell at the caster. For example, if you reflect a @spell[fireball], you can center the effects of that @spell[fireball] on that caster instead. Furthermore, when you cast the spell @spell[dispel magic], in addition to its normal effects you can target yourself with one spell which was dispelled. For example, if you dispel the spell @spell[mage armor], you can choose to cast @spell[mage armor] on yourself. Even if the spell can usually target more than you, or cannot target you, it always targets you in this case. Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: High Arcanum
entries: At 14th level, you can cast a 6th or 7th level spell one additional time. Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Chaos Mage
entries: Chaos Mages have chosen to master the unpredictable art of casting wild magic, a form of arcane magic noted for its erratic behavior, devastatingly powerful and random effects. Wild mages believe that the best magic is raw magic itself.

subclassFeature.name: Wild Magic
entries: At 1st level, whenever you cast a spell or cantrip you have learned from this class, roll a 1d100. If the result is odd, it is affected by wild magic. If it is even, it is cast as normal. When your spells are affected by wild magic, roll once on the Negative Wild Magic table, then roll once on the Positive Wild Magic table. Each wild magic effect is categorized. If the rolled Positive Wild Magic result has the same categorisation as the rolled Negative Wild Magic result, re-roll.

subclassFeature.name: Chaos Points
entries: At 1st level, you gain a pool of points known as Chaos Points. The number of points you have is equal to your proficiency bonus. You regain all expended Chaos Points when you finish a long rest. You can use your Chaos Points the following ways:

items.entry: When you roll on the Negative Wild Magic table or Positive Wild Magic table, you can spend two Chaos Points to cancel the rolled effect.
When you roll on the Negative Wild Magic table or Positive Wild Magic table, you can spend one Surge Point to re-roll the effect.

subclassFeature.name: Determined Chaos
entries: At 6th level, instead of rolling on the Negative Wild Magic table or Positive Wild Magic table, you can select which effects occur. Once you use this feature, you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Unstable Backlash
entries: At 10th level, immediately after you take damage or fail a saving throw, you can use your reaction to roll on the Wild Magic table and immediately produce the effect rolled. This effect replaces your current Wild Magic effect.

subclassFeature.name: Raw Magic
entries: At 14th level, you can cast any spell from any class spell list. You must still expend a number of magic points equal to the level of the spell and cannot cast a 6th, 7th, 8th or 9th level spell if you have already done so since your last long rest. When you have used this feature twice, you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Eldritch Archer
entries: More than a mere archer, Eldritch Archers have mastered ranged weapons and know when to make use of them and when to employ their spells. As true experts of ranged combat, few even notice the Eldritch Archer before it has struck them down from afar.

subclassFeature.name: Ranged Training
entries: At 1st level, you gain proficiency with light armor, and martial ranged weapons.

subclassFeature.name: Expert Archer
entries: At 1st level, you gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls you make with ranged weapon attacks and ranged spell attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: At 6th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn. Moreover, you can cast one of your cantrips that requires a ranged attack roll in place of one of those attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Magic Arrow
entries: At 10th level, you gain the ability to infuse arrows with magic. Whenever you fire a non magical arrow from a ranged weapon, you can make it magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to non magical attacks and damage. The magic fades from the arrow immediately after it hits or misses its target. In addition, you can change the type of damage the arrow inflicts to the same damage inflicted by a spell you can cast.

subclassFeature.name: Curve Shot
entries: At 14th level, you learn how to direct an errant attack toward a new target. When you make an attack roll with a ranged weapon or spell, you can use a bonus action to reroll the attack roll against a different target within 60 feet of the original target. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus. You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Electromancer
entries: Harnessing the power of elemental lightning, the Electromancer is a master of electric magic. Electromancers use the element of lightning to shock their foes into submission as electricity crackles through their very being.

subclassFeature.name: Wrath of the Storm
entries: At 1st level, when a creature within 5 feet of you that you can see hits you with an attack, you can use your reaction to cause the creature to make a Dexterity saving throw. The creature takes 2d8 lightning on a failed saving throw, and half as much damage on a successful one. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus. You regain all uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Destructive Wrath
entries: At 1st level, when you roll lightning damage, you can choose to deal maximum damage, instead of rolling. You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Thunderous Smite
entries: At 6th level, you gain the ability to infuse your weapon strikes with divine energy. Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can cause the attack to deal an extra 1d8 lightning damage to the target. When you reach 14th level, the extra damage increases to 2d8.

subclassFeature.name: Nourishing Electric
entries: At 10th level, your lightning spells soothe and restore you. When you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that includes a lightning damage roll, you regain hit points equal to the spell's level + your proficiency bonus.

subclassFeature.name: Fathomless Clouds
entries: At 14th level, you can magically open temporary conduits under the clouds. As an action, you can teleport yourself and up to five other willing creatures that you can see within 30 feet of you. Amid a whirl of harmless lightning, you all vanish and then reappear up to 1 mile away in the outdoors you've seen or within 30 feet of it, each of you appearing in an unoccupied space within 30 feet of the others. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Geomancer
entries: Harnessing the power of elemental earth, the Geomancer is a master of rock magic. Geomancers use the element of earth to rock the very foundations beneath them and collapse mountainous ranges upon their foes.

subclassFeature.name: Rocky Durability
entries: At 1st level, your connection to stone gives you extra fortitude. Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 again whenever you gain a level.

subclassFeature.name: Stoney Skin
entries: At 1st level, as an action, you can increase your armor class. Your armor class equals a base of 13. In addition for every metamagic point you expend it increases by a further 1. For example, if you expend 2 metamagic points, your AC equals 15. You can only benefit from this increase if you aren’t wearing armor, and your skin assumes a stony appearance. This effect lasts until you end it as a bonus action, you are incapacitated, you don armor or a shield, or you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Earthly Glide
entries: At 6th level, you gain a burrowing speed equal to half your walking speed. You can burrow through non magical, unworked earth and stone. While doing so, you don't disturb the material you move through. While burrowing you gain tremorsense equal to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Solid Flesh
entries: At 10th level, you gain advantage on all saving throws against becoming restrained or knocked prone and you are immune to the petrified condition.

subclassFeature.name: Mountainous Defense
entries: At 14th level, as an action, you gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage for 1 minute. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Hydromancer
entries: Harnessing the power of elemental earth, the Hydromancer is a master of rock magic. Hydromancers use the element of earth to rock the very foundations beneath them and collapse mountainous ranges upon their foes.

subclassFeature.name: Gift of the Sea
entries: At 1st level, you gain a swimming equal to your walking speed, and you can breathe underwater.

subclassFeature.name: Curse of the Sea
entries: At 1st level, when you hit a creature with a cantrip you can curse the target until the end of your next turn. Once per turn when you cast a spell that deals cold or acid damage to a cursed target, the target is subject to an additional effect.
Cold Damage. The target’s speed is also reduced by 15 feet until the end of your next turn. If the spell already reduces the target’s speed, use whichever reduction is greater.
Acid Damage. The target takes additional acid damage equal to your proficiency bonus.

subclassFeature.name: Oceanic Soul
entries: At 6th level, you gain resistance to cold damage. In addition, when you are fully submerged, any creature that is also fully submerged can understand your speech, and you can understand theirs.

subclassFeature.name: Watery Defense
entries: At 10th level, as a reaction when you take  bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage, you can reduce that damage by an amount equal to your level plus your proficiency bonus, and then you can move up to 30 feet without provoking opportunity attacks. You can use this a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and regain all uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Liquid Form
entries: At 14th level, you can enter a liquid state while moving. When you move on your turn, you take only half damage from opportunity attacks, and you can move through any enemy’s space but can’t end your move there. Critical hits against you during this movement become normal hits. On your turn, you can move through any space and do so without squeezing. When you stop moving, the regular squeezing rules apply if you’re in a space one size smaller than you. You can’t willingly stop in a space smaller than that, and if forced to do so, you immediately flow to the nearest space that can fit you, back along the path of your movement.

subclassFeature.name: Lore Mage
entries: Knowledge is power and Lore Mages believe in studying every nuggest of information they can get their hands on. With that knowledge, Lore Mages have tend to know how to unlock the secrets of abilities other mages see as standard.

subclassFeature.name: Initiate of Learning
entries: At 1st level, you learn an additional two cantrips of your choice. These cantrips do not count towards the number of cantrips you know. In addition, you can prepare two spells than normal.

subclassFeature.name: General Knowledge
entries: At 1st level, you can add half your proficiency bonus, rounded down, to any ability check you make that doesn't already include your proficiency bonus.

subclassFeature.name: Know Your Enemy
entries: At 6th level, you can cast the spell Kiman’s Metagaming without expending magic points. When you do so, you can roll 4d4 instead of 2d4. Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Metamagic Adept
entries: At 10th level, you learn an additional two Metamagic options of your choice. Whenever you reach a level in this class, you can replace one of these Metamagic options with another one. You also gain an additional 2 metamagic points.

subclassFeature.name: Magic Item Savant
entries: At 14th level, your skill with magic items deepens. You ignore all requirements on attuning to or using a magic item.

subclassFeature.name: Mind Mage
entries: Why not just study the power of psionics you ask? Well these mages believe they have found the perfect balance between the two, mastering both magic and psionics and able to employ them to gain advantage over any other mage.

subclassFeature.name: Telepathic Speech
entries: At 1st level, as a bonus action, choose one non hostile creature within 30 feet of you. You can speak telepathically while the two of you are within a number of miles of each other equal to your proficiency bonus. The telepathic connection lasts for a number of minutes equal to your level. It ends early if either of you are incapacitated, die or if you use this ability to form a connection with a different creature.

subclassFeature.name: Psychic Force
entries: At 1st level, you can prepare a number of spells from the psion spell list equal to your proficiency bonus. In addition, when you cast a spell or cantrip that inflicts radiant or force damage, it can inflict psychic damage instead.

subclassFeature.name: Psionic Magic
entries: At 6th level, when you cast any spell that inflicts psychic damage, or requires an Intelligence saving throw it requires no verbal, somatic or material, unless they are consumed by the spell. You can use this a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Psychic Blades
entries: At 10th level, whenever you take the Attack action, you can manifest a psychic blade in your free hand and make the attack with that blade. The blade is a simple melee weapon with the finesse and thrown properties.

You are considered proficient with it. It has a normal range of 60 feet and an unlimited long range. On a hit it deals 3d8 psychic damage. The blade vanishes immediately after the attack. After you attack with the blade, you can make a melee or ranged weapon attack with a second psychic blade as a bonus action on the same turn, provided your other hand is free to create it. The damage die of this bonus attack is 3d6.

subclassFeature.name: Psychic Defenses
entries: At 14th level, you gain immunity to psychic damage, and you have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened. Moreover, if you start your turn charmed or frightened, you can expend one metamagic point to end those conditions.

subclassFeature.name: Primal Mage
entries: Sometimes referred to as Green Mages, these spellcasters find comfort in nature and value the incredible magical power that can be gleaned from it, thus bridging the gap between the arcane and primal forces.

subclassFeature.name: Wild Shaping
entries: At 1st level, you can use your action to magically assume the shape of a beast as if you had been subject to the @spell[polymorph] spell. When transformed in this way however, you can only transform into a beast with a challenge rating equal to your Mage level divided by 8, rounded down. The effect lasts for a number of minutes equal to your Mage level. You do not need to concentrate to maintain the effects and can dismiss them early as a bonus action. Once used, you can’t use this ability again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Primal Magic
entries: At 1st level, you can prepare a number of spells from the druid and ranger spell lists equal to your proficiency bonus. These spells cannot heal hit points or provide temporary hit points.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Shape
entries: At 6th level, you can transform into a beast with a challenge rating as high as your Mage level divided by 3, rounded down. In addition, you can transform a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus.

subclassFeature.name: Expert Morphing
entries: At 10th level, you can transform into a beast with a challenge rating equal to your Mage level and the effect lasts for up to 1 hour. Also, while you are transformed by Wild Shaping, you gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from non-magical attacks. In addition, you gain the ability to use Wild Shaping as a reaction when you take damage, and the damage from that attack is applied to the hit points of your beast form.

subclassFeature.name: Natural Protection
entries: At 14th level, while you are transformed by Wild Shaping, you can't be charmed, diseased, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, or poisoned. In addition, you are immune to poison damage.

subclassFeature.name: Pyromancer
entries: Harnessing the power of elemental fire, the Pyromancer is a master of blazing flame magic. Pyromancers use the element of fire to scorch everything in their path. Everything burns given enough fire and the right temperature.

subclassFeature.name: Hearts on Fire
entries: At 1st level, whenever you start casting a spell of 1st level or higher that deals fire damage, fiery magic erupts from you. This eruption causes creatures of your choice that you can see within 10 feet of you to take fire damage equal to half your level (minimum of 1).

subclassFeature.name: Warding Flare
entries: At 1st level, you can interpose divine light between yourself and an attacking enemy. When you are attacked by a creature within 30 feet of you that you can see, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll, causing light to flare before the attacker before it hits or misses.
An attacker that can't be blinded is immune to this feature. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus. You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Fire in the Veins
entries: At 6th level, You gain resistance to fire damage. In addition, spells you cast ignore resistance to fire damage.

subclassFeature.name: Pyromancer's Fury
entries: At 10th level, When you are hit by a melee attack, you can use your reaction to deal fire damage to the attacker. The damage equals your level, and ignores resistance to fire damage.

subclassFeature.name: Fiery Soul
entries: At 14th level, You gain immunity to fire damage. In addition, any spell or effect you create ignores resistance to fire damage and treats immunity to fire damage as resistance to fire damage.

subclassFeature.name: Rage Mage
entries: Some mages have a temper. However, unlike thrashing around like a Minotaur in a Alchemists shop, the fury of these mages usually ends in the total destruction and fire of an entire market. So don't upset these spell-toting rampagers.

subclassFeature.name: Rampage
entries: At 1st level, you are overcome with a magical ferocity. On your turn, you can enter a rampage as a bonus action. While rampaging, you gain the following features if you aren't wearing armor:

items.entry: When you cast a spell, you can add extra force damage to one damage die equal to your proficiency bonus.
You have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
You can't concentrate on spells and you can’t cast spells with a duration of longer than Instantaneous.

entries: Your rampage lasts for a number of rounds equal to your proficiency bonus. It ends early if you are knocked unconscious or if your turn ends and you haven't cast a cantrip or spell of 1st level or higher since your last turn. You can also end your rampage on your turn as a bonus action.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus. You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: At 1st level, while you are not wearing any armor, your Armor Class equals 10 + your Dexterity or Constitution modifier + your spellcasting ability modifier. You cannot use a shield and still gain this benefit.

subclassFeature.name: Angry Spell
entries: At 6th level, once per round, when you cast a spell of 1st level or higher while rampaging, your spell attack roll and save DC has a bonus equal to half your proficiency bonus (rounded down).

subclassFeature.name: Relentless Rampage
entries: At 10th level, if you drop to 0 hit points while rampaging and don't die outright, you can make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw. If you succeed, you drop to 1 hit point instead. Each time you use this feature after the first, the DC increases by 5. When you finish a long rest, the DC resets to 10.

subclassFeature.name: Magical Retribution
entries: At 14th level, when you take damage while rampaging, as a reaction you can use a cantrip against that creature.

subclassFeature.name: Red Wizard
entries: The Red Wizards of Thay have a rather malicious reputation. However, none can deny that their methods and knowledge of circle magic was some of the most powerful magic techniques the multiverse had ever seen. A Red Wizard seeks to continue their craft.

subclassFeature.name: Shared Spells
entries: At 1st level, when an ally is within 5 feet of you, providing it is of a level you can cast, you can cast any spell they know or have prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Joint Concentration
entries: At 1st level, when you are within 5 feet of an ally who fails a Constitution saving throw to maintain concentration; As a reaction, you can attempt the same Constitution saving throw. If you succeed, the original caster is no longer concentrating on the spell and you gain control of the concentration instead.

subclassFeature.name: Circle Magic
entries: At 6th level, when another creature you can see is casting a spell, as a reaction you can apply metamagic options to that spell as if you had cast the spell. In addition, for every two allies within 5 feet of you, you can cast a spell at 1 level higher than you can normally. You must still expend the magic points. For example, if you can cast up to 5th level spells and there are 4 allies within 5 feet of you. You can cast the spell at 7th level by expending an additional 3 magic points.

subclassFeature.name: Helping Hand
entries: At 10th level, when a creature you can see casts a spell, as a reaction you can expend additional magic points to increase the level of the spell.

For example if a 2nd level spell is cast, you can expend 3 magic points to heighten it to 4th level. The spell cannot be heightened beyond a level for which you can cast. When a spell is heightened in this way, the spell uses your spell attack bonus and spell save DC.

subclassFeature.name: Empower Spell
entries: At 14th level, when another creature you can see is casting a spell, you can expend magic points as if you were casting the spell to increase the damage of the spell. The number of damage die rolled is increased by half. For example, if a creature was casting fireball, you expend 5 magic points and the damage of the spell would increase from 8d6 to 12d6.

subclassFeature.name: Sage
entries: Sometimes referred to as White Mages, these spellcasters find have found a spiritual connection in religion or find altruism their calling. Sage's bridge the gap between the arcane and divine forces.

subclassFeature.name: Disciple of Life
entries: At 1st level, you can prepare any spell that heals hit points. In addition, when you use a spell of 1st level or higher to restore hit points to a creature, the creature regains additional hit points equal to 2 + the spell's level.

subclassFeature.name: Preserve Life
entries: At 1st level, as an action, you can evoke healing energy that can restore a number of hit points equal to five times level. Choose any creatures within 30 feet of you, and divide those hit points among them. This feature can restore a creature to no more than half of its hit point maximum. You can't use this feature on an undead or a construct. Once you have used this feature, you can't use it again until you have finished a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Blessed Healer
entries: At 6th level, the healing spells you cast on others heal you as well. When you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that restores hit points to a creature other than you, you regain hit points equal to 2 + the spell's level.

subclassFeature.name: Death's Door
entries: At 10th level, you gain the ability to manipulate the line between life and death. When you would normally roll one or more dice to restore hit points with a spell to a creature at 0 hit points, you instead use the highest number possible for each die. Also, you gain the ability to impede death’s progress. As a reaction when you or an ally that you can see within 30 feet of you suffers a critical hit, you can turn that attack into a normal hit. Any effects triggered by a critical hit are canceled. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus. You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Supreme Healing
entries: At 14th level, when you would normally roll one or more dice to restore hit points with a spell, you instead use the highest number possible for each die. For example, instead of restoring 2d6 hit points to a creature, you restore 12.

subclassFeature.name: Scrollmaster
entries: Dusty books and reams of parchment may seem like a tedious chore. But Scrollmasters know how to use the written word to leap off the page. Through the study of ancient scriptures these mages know how to unlock the great mystery of magic through scrolls.

subclassFeature.name: Scroll Collector
entries: At 1st level, you have a wide array of knowledge when it comes to scrolls and can use that to your benefit when making or purchasing them. Scrolls are sold to you at half price and cost half the usual price to craft.

subclassFeature.name: Expert Scribe
entries: At 1st level, your affinity with scrolls allows you to cast spells from scrolls from other class lists. For example, if you have a spell scroll of the spell Beacon of Hope, you can cast it from the scroll as if it were a Mage Spell. The scroll is then consumed after use.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Scroll
entries: At 6th level, when casting a spell from a scroll, you can choose to use your spellcasting save DC and spellcasting attack bonus if those defined on the scroll are lower.

subclassFeature.name: Beyond Your Years
entries: At 10th level, Your magical mastery of scrolls has reached new heights. When you cast a spell of 2nd level or lower from a scroll, spells with an instantaneous duration cannot be subject to a counterspell. You can use this a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and regain all uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Maintainable Scrolls
entries: At 14th level, You have learned how to handle weaker magic in ways beyond your peers. If you cast a spell from a scroll of 2nd level or lower that requires concentration, and you are already concentrating on another spell, concentration can be maintained on both. If you fail a concentration check however, you lose concentration on both spells. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Spell Thief
entries: Sure enough, simple study of magic is a powerful ally. However, there is always a bigger fish. Spell Thiefs give them self the advantage by stealing magical power from others and turning it back their enemeies.

subclassFeature.name: Sneaky Magic
entries: At 1st level, once per turn when you cast a spell that requires a spell attack roll, you can deal extra damage to one creature you hit with an attack if you have advantage on the attack roll. You don't need advantage on the attack roll if another enemy of the target is within 5 feet of it, that enemy isn't incapacitated, and you don't have disadvantage on the attack roll. The extra damage is equal to your level.

subclassFeature.name: Blind Fighting
entries: At 1st level, you have blindsight with a range of 10 feet. Within that range, you can effectively see anything that isn't behind total cover, even if you're blinded or in darkness. Moreover, you can see an invisible creature within that range, unless the creature successfully hides from you.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Thievery
entries: At 6th level, when a creature within 60 feet of you that you can see casts a spell that targets you or includes you in its area of effect, you can use your reaction to force the creature to make a saving throw equal to your spell save DC with its spellcasting ability. On a failed save, you negate the spell's effect and steal the knowledge of the spell if it is of a level you can cast. For the next 8 hours, you know the spell and can cast it. The creature can't cast that spell until the 8 hours have passed.
You can use this a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and regain all uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Eldritch Ambush
entries: At 10th level, once per turn, when you cast a spell at a creature you are hidden from, the creature has disadvantage on any saving throw it makes against the spell or you have advantage on the spell attack roll against the creature for this turn.

subclassFeature.name: Death Strike
entries: At 14th level, when you hit a creature with a spell that requires an attack roll and that creature is surprised or incapacitated, it must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, double the damage of your attack.

subclassFeature.name: Spellsword
entries: When magic just wont do, Spellswords always have their trusty weapon in hand. Unlike other mages, Spellswords seek to combine the martial prowess of a great warrior with the mystical abilities of wise and powerful seer.

subclassFeature.name: Martial Prowess
entries: At 1st level, you gain proficiency with light armor, and martial melee weapons.

subclassFeature.name: Eldritch Smite
entries: At 1st level, once per turn when you hit a creature with a martial melee weapon, you can expend magic points (maximum equal to your proficiency bonus) to deal extra damage. For every magic point expended you deal an extra 1d6 force damage to the target.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: At 6th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.
Moreover, you can cast one of your cantrips that requires an attack roll in place of one of those attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Eldritch Strike
entries: At 10th level, you can use your spellcasting ability modifier for attack and damage rolls with melee attacks using martial weapons. In addition, you have learned how to make your weapon strikes undercut a creature's resistance to your spells. When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, that creature has disadvantage on the next saving throw it makes against a spell you cast before the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Battle Magic
entries: At 14th level, you have mastered the art of weaving spellcasting and weapon use into a single harmonious act. When you use your action to cast a spell, you can make one weapon attack with a martial  melee weapon as a bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Summoner
entries: When a simple fireball wont do, summoning powerful monstrous creatures to do your bidding surely will. These mages find the best offense is through your trusty minions and their extraordinary abilities.

subclassFeature.name: Remarkable Familiar
entries: At 1st level, you learn the find familiar spell and can cast it as a ritual. The spell doesn't count against your number of spells known. You can communicate telepathically with your familiar and perceive through your familiar's senses as long as you are on the same plane of existence.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Cohort
entries: At 1st level, when you cast find familiar, you infuse the summoned familiar with a measure of your eldritch power, granting the creature the following benefits: The familiar gains either a flying speed or a swimming speed (your choice) of 40 feet. As a bonus action, you can command the familiar to take the Attack action. If the familiar forces a creature to make a saving throw, it uses your spell save DC. When the familiar takes damage, you can use your reaction to grant it resistance against that damage.

subclassFeature.name: Mighty Summoner
entries: At 6th level, any creature summoned or created by a spell that you cast gains two benefits:

items.entry: The creature appears with 2 extra hit points per Hit Die it has.
The damage from its natural weapons are considered magical for the purpose of overcoming immunity and resistance to non magical attacks and damage.

entries: Also, when you summon a familiar, you can choose one of the normal forms for your familiar or one of the following special forms: imp, pseudodragon, quasit, or sprite.

subclassFeature.name: Double Concentrate
entries: At 10th level, while you are concentrating on a spell that has summoned or created a creature, your concentration can't be broken as a result of taking damage. In addition, the duration of the spell is doubled.

subclassFeature.name: Share Spells
entries: At 14th level, when you cast a spell targeting yourself, you can also affect one creature you have summoned or created with the same spell if the creature is within 30 feet of you.

subclassFeature.name: Universal Mage
entries: Specializing in one specific area of magic is a taboo for Universal Mages. These mages believe that every type of magic deserves equal attention. Of course, through study of eveything they become jack of all trades.

subclassFeature.name: Universal Savant
entries: At 1st level, you can prepare a number of spells not on your class list equal to your proficiency bonus. These spells still count as part of the total number of spells you can prepare as normal.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Expertise
entries: At 1st level, you also gain proficiency in the Arcana skill. If you are already proficient in Arcana, you may double your proficiency bonus when you make ability checks with it.

subclassFeature.name: Specialized Boon
entries: At 6th level, choose one school of magic. Whenever you use a Metamagic option on a spell from that school of magic, you can reduce the metamagic points spent by 1 (minimum 0). You can reduce the metamagic points spent for your Metamagic a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Prodigious Inspiration
entries: At 10th level, you have attained a greater mastery of spell preparation. As a bonus action, you can replace one spell you have prepared with another spell. You can’t use this ability again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Knowledge
entries: At 14th level, you've managed to figure out some of the simpler spells you know. Choose one 1st level, one 2nd level, and one 3rd level spell. These spells are always prepared for you, and don't count against your maximum number of prepared spells. At the end of a long rest you may choose to change one of these spells for another.

subclassFeature.name: Wand Mage
entries: Wand Mages just seem to have an endless supply of magic as they have a wand for everything with a plethora of spells. It can be an expensive business buying wands, but it always pays to have them in your arsenal.

subclassFeature.name: Wand Savvy
entries: At 1st level, you have an affinity with wands and put that to good use when acquiring them. Wands are sold to you at half price and cost half the usual price to craft.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Juice
entries: At 1st level, you can get more out of a wand than normal. Wands in your possession have a number of additional charges equal to your proficiency bonus. In addition, when expending the last charge from a wand, the wand is not destroyed.

subclassFeature.name: Unlimited Charge
entries: At 6th level, as an action, you can refuel charges in a wand. For every 2 magic points expended, the wand regains 1 charge. In addition, before finishing a long rest, you can expend any remaining magic points to refuel wands. A wand regains half the number of charges (rounded down) equal to the number of magic points remaining.

subclassFeature.name: Daily Fuel
entries: At 10th level, when finishing a long rest, you can choose a number of wands equal to your proficiency bonus to automatically regain a number of charges. The number of charges equals your proficiency bonus.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Wand
entries: At 14th level, when casting spells from a wand you gain a +3 bonus to spell attack rolls and to the saving throw DCs. In addition, you ignore half cover when making a spell attack.

subclassFeature.name: Egoist
entries: A psion who specializes in psychometabolism is known as an egoist. This discipline consists of powers that alter the psion’s psychobiology, or that of creatures near him. An egoist can both transform themself into a fearsome fighter.

subclassFeature.name: Disciplined in Psychometabolism
entries: At 1st level and every two levels thereafter, you learn two additional 1st-level spells of your choice from any spell list. The spells you choose must be from the Abjuration school of magic or provide you with temporary hit points. Each time you level up in this class, you can change both spells, however, they must still meet the same criteria.

subclassFeature.name: Psychic Fortitude
entries: At 1st level, your psionic energy grants you extraordinary fortitude. At the start of each of your turns, you gain temporary hit points equal to your proficiency bonus if you have at least 1 hit point.

subclassFeature.name: Psychic Resistance
entries: Beginning at 6th level, you can direct your psionic power to absorb damage. When you take damage, you can use your reaction to expend power points and reduce that damage to you by an amount equal to five times the power points expended.

subclassFeature.name: Astral Form
entries: At 14th level, you gain the ability to become a ghostly figure of psionic energy. As an action, you can transform into a transparent, ghostly version of yourself.

While in this form, you have resistance to all damage, move at half speed, and can pass through objects and creatures while moving but can’t willingly end your movement in their spaces. The form lasts for 10 minutes or until you use an action to end it. Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Kineticist
entries: Psions who specialize in psychokinesis are known as kineticists. They are the masters of powers that manipulate and transform matter and energy. Kineticists can attack with devastating blasts of energy.

subclassFeature.name: Disciplined in Psychokinesis
entries: At 1st level, you learn two additional 1st-level spells of your choice from any spell list. The spells you choose must contain the acid, cold, fire, lightning or thunder damage type. Each time you level up in this class, you can change both spells, however, they must still meet the same criteria.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Affinity
entries: At 1st level, each time after you finish a short or long rest choose acid, cold, fire, lightning or thunder. When you manifest a power that inflicts damage of your chosen type, you can ignore a creature’s resistance to that chosen type.

subclassFeature.name: Transmute Elements
entries: At 6th level, when you manifest a power that deals acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage, you expend 1 Power Point to substitute that damage type with the same type you have chosen as per the class feature Elemental Affinity.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Master
entries: Starting at 14th level, as a reaction, when you receive damage of the same type you have chosen in the class feature Elemental Affinity, you can spend 2 Power Points to ignore that damage; gaining immunity of that damage type until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Nomad
entries: A psion who relies on psychoportation powers is known as a nomad. Nomads can wield powers that propel or displace objects in space or time.

subclassFeature.name: Disciplined in Psychoportation
entries: At 1st level and every two levels thereafter, you learn two additional 1st-level spells of your choice from any spell list. The spells you choose must change your movement speed, allow you to gain new speed types (such as flight), or allow you teleport. Each time you level up in this class, you can change both spells, however, they must still meet the same criteria.

subclassFeature.name: Memory of One Thousand Steps
entries: At 1st level, you gain the ability to use psionics to recall your steps. As a reaction when you are hit by an attack, you can teleport to an unoccupied space that you occupied since the start of your last turn, and the attack misses you. Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Astral Movement
entries: At 6th level, you gain a superior talent for teleportation. When you use a spell to teleport any distance, that distance increases by 15 feet. This distance increases by a further 5 feet when you reach 9th, 13th and 17th level.

subclassFeature.name: Effortless Journey
entries: Starting at 14th level, your mind can mystically move your body. Once on each of your turns, you can forfeit up to 30 feet of your movement to teleport the distance you forfeited. You must teleport to an unoccupied space you can see.

subclassFeature.name: Seer
entries: A psion who chooses clairsentience is known as a seer. Seers can learn precognitive powers to aid their comrades in combat, as well as powers that permit them to gather information in many different ways.

subclassFeature.name: Disciplined in Claiersentience
entries: At 1st level and every two levels thereafter, you learn two additional 1st-level spells of your choice from any spell list. The spells you choose must be from the Divination school of magic, provide you a new type of vision (such as darkvision) or allow you to make additional dice rolls. Each time you level up in this class, you can change both spells, however, they must still meet the same criteria.

subclassFeature.name: Precognition
entries: At 1st level, your keen ability to assess tactical situations allows you to act quickly in battle. You can give yourself a bonus to your initiative rolls equal to your proficiency bonus. In addition, You can't be surprised while you are conscious.

subclassFeature.name: Premonition
entries: At 6th level, you gain a Premonition die, a d6. As a reaction when you are forced to make a saving throw, you can roll the die and add the number rolled to it. You can wait until after you roll the d20 before deciding to use the Premonition die, but must decide before the DM says whether the roll succeeds or fails.
Alternatively, when an attack roll is made against you, you can use your reaction to roll the Premonition die and add the number rolled to your AC against that attack.

Once the Premonition die is rolled, it is lost. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus. You regain any expended uses when you finish a long rest. Your Premonition die changes when you reach certain levels in this class. The die becomes a d8 at 9th level, a d10 at 13th level, and a d12 at 17th level.

subclassFeature.name: Astral Sight
entries: At 14th level, you gain a superior talent for viewing the unseen. You have truesight to a range of 30 feet and you can see in normal and magical darkness, see invisible creatures and objects, automatically detect visual illusions and succeed on saving throws against them, and perceive the original form of a shapechanger or a creature that is transformed by magic. Furthermore, you can see into the Ethereal Plane.

subclassFeature.name: Telepath
entries: A psion who chooses the discipline of telepathy is known as a telepath. He is the master of powers that allow mental contact and control of other sentient creatures. A telepath can deceive or destroy the minds of his enemies with ease.

subclassFeature.name: Disciplined in Telepathy
entries: At 1st level and every two levels thereafter, you learn two additional 1st-level spells of your choice from any spell list. The spells you choose must enable you to communicate with another creature, require a creature to make an Intelligence saving throw or deal psychic damage. Each time you level up in this class, you can change both spells, however, they must still meet the same criteria.

subclassFeature.name: Telepathy
entries: At 1st level, your mind awakens to the ability to communicate via telepathy. You can telepathically speak to any creature you can see within 120 feet of you in this manner. You don’t need to share a language with the creature for it to understand your telepathic messages, but the creature must be able to understand at least one language or be telepathic itself. An unwilling creature can hear your telepathic speech, but must willingly communicate with you for you to hear its telepathic speech.

subclassFeature.name: Psychic Command
entries: At 6th level, for 1 minute you can concentrate (as if you were concentrating on a power). During this time, as a bonus action on each of your turns, you can attempt to control another creature as if you had cast the Command spell.
Any creature charmed by you automatically fails its saving throw against the Command you use with this feature. Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Force of Will
entries: At 14th level, your telepathic powers are so powerful they can overcome the strongest of defenses. When you manifest a power that attempts to charm a creature immune to the charmed condition, they instead must make a saving throw, but do so with advantage.

subclassFeature.name: Wilder
entries: Unlike most psions, who studies his psionic ability and potential to unlock its secrets, the wilder taps into their emotions to unlock and unleash their innate psionic power. By channeling their emotions in such a fashion, the wilder greatly enhances their psionic powers, but runs the risk of suffering backlash, as emotions are unstable.

subclassFeature.name: Universal Discipline
entries: At 1st level and every two levels thereafter, you learn two additional 1st-level spells of your choice from the sorcerer or psion spell lists. Each time you level up in this class, you can change both spells.

subclassFeature.name: Wild Psionics
entries: At 1st level, you are psionically connected to wild magic so powerful that your spells have a chance of being affected by a random effect. Whenever you cast a spell or cantrip you have learned from this class, roll a 1d100. If the result is odd, it is affected by wild magic. If it is even, it is cast as normal.
When your spells are affected by wild magic, roll once on the Negative Wild Magic table, then roll once on the Positive Wild Magic table.
Each wild magic effect is categorized, such as Damage or Range. If the rolled Positive Wild Magic result has the same categorisation as the rolled Negative Wild Magic result, re-roll.

subclassFeature.name: Surge Points
entries: At 1st level, you gain a pool of points known as Surge Points. The number of points you have is equal to your proficiency bonus. You can use your surge points the following ways:

items.entry: When you roll on the Negative Wild Magic table or Positive Wild Magic table, you can spend two Surge Points to cancel the rolled effect.
When you roll on the Negative Wild Magic table or Positive Wild Magic table, you can spend one Surge Point to re-roll the effect.

entries: You regain all expended Surge Points when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Determined Surge
entries: At 6th level, instead of rolling on the Negative Wild Magic table or Positive Wild Magic table, you can select which effects occur. Once you use this feature, you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Access to the Weave
entries: At 14th level, instead of casting a spell you know from this class, you can cast any spell from any class spell list. You must still expend a number of power points equal to the level of the spell and cannot cast a 6th, 7th, 8th or 9th level spell if you have already done so since your last long rest. When you have used this feature twice, you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Careful Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that forces other creatures to make a saving throw, you can protect some of those creatures from the spell's full force. To do so, you spend 1 Metamagic Point and choose a number of those creatures up to your spellcasting ability modifier (minimum of one creature). A chosen creature automatically succeeds on its saving throw against the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Chain Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that targets only one creature and deals either acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage. After the primary target is struck, the spell can arc to secondary targets. For every secondary target you must expend a number of Metamagic Points equal to half the spell's level (rounded down).

Each secondary target receives half the damage (rounded down) dealt to the primary target. If the spell requires a saving throw, the secondary targets also make a saving throw. If the spell requires a spell attack, make an attack roll against each secondary target.
You can choose any secondary targets, but they must all be within 30 feet of the primary target, and no target can be struck more than once.

optionalfeature.name: Delay Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that has a radius area of effect or range of self, you can spend 2 metamagic points to delay the effects of the spell. When you cast the spell, choose one of the following triggers:

items: The spell activates when you take an bonus action to activate it; or
If the spell has an area of affect, the spell activates when any creature enters the area that the spell will affect; or

entries: If neither of these conditions are met, the spell automatically triggers at the end of your turn in 2 rounds time. For every additional metamagic point you expend above 2, the spell can be delayed by an additional round.

Any decisions you would make about the delayed spell, including attack rolls, designating targets, or determining the shape of the spell, are decided when the spell is cast. Any effects resolved by those affected by the spell, including saving throws, are decided when the delay period ends.
A delayed spell can be dispelled normally during the delay, and can be detected normally in the area or on the target by the use of spells that can detect magical effects.

optionalfeature.name: Distant Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that has a range of 5 feet or greater, you can spend 1 Metamagic Point to double the range of the spell.
When you cast a spell that has a range of touch, you can spend 1 Metamagic Point to make the range of the spell 30 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Empowered Spell
entries: When you roll damage for a spell, you can spend 1 Metamagic Point to reroll a number of the damage dice up to your spellcasting abiility modifier (minimum of one). You must use the new rolls.
You can use Empowered Spell even if you have already used a different Metamagic option during the casting of the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Extended Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that has a duration of 1 minute or longer, you can spend 1 Metamagic Point to double its duration, to a maximum duration of 24 hours.

optionalfeature.name: Focused Spell
entries: When you cast a spell, you can spend 3 Metamagic Points to have advantage on Constitution saving throws that you make to maintain your concentration on that spell when you take damage.

optionalfeature.name: Heightened Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that forces a creature to make a saving throw to resist its effects, you can spend 3 Metamagic Points to give one target of the spell disadvantage on its first saving throw made against the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Maximize Spell
entries: When you cast a spell of 1st through 5th-level that targets only one creature and doesn't have a range of self, you can spend a number of Metamagic Points equal to the spell's level +2 to deal maximum damage with that spell.

optionalfeature.name: Mimic Spell
entries: When you see another creature cast a spell, as a reaction, you can spend a number of Metamagic Points equal to the level of the spell. Until you finish a long rest, you can cast this spell, at the original level it was cast, as if you have it prepared.

optionalfeature.name: Quickened Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that has a casting time of 1 action, you can spend 2 Metamagic Points to change the casting time to 1 bonus action for this casting.

optionalfeature.name: Reactive Spell
entries: When a hostile creature's movement provokes an opportunity attack from you, you can spend 2 Metamagic Points and use your reaction to cast a spell at the creature, rather than making an opportunity attack. The spell must have a casting time of 1 action and must target only that creature.

optionalfeature.name: Reshape Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that has an area of effect from the following list, you can spend 3 Metamagic Points to change that area of effect to one of the other listed types: cone, cylinder or line.
The spell must still target the same area however. For example, a 15 foot cone can instead be reshaped into a 30 foot by 5 foot line.

optionalfeature.name: Seeking Spell
entries: If you make an attack roll for a spell and miss, you can spend 2 Metamagic Points to reroll the d20, and you must use the new roll.
You can use Seeking Spell even if you have already used a different Metamagic option during the casting of the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Spectral Spell
entries: When you cast a spell of 1st through 5th-level that targets only one creature, you can spend a number of Metamagic Points equal to the spell's level to bypass any barrier the creature is behind by skipping through the Ethereal Plane.
If the spell requires line of sight, you cannot cast it as a Spectral Spell unless you can still see the target.

optionalfeature.name: Subtle Spell
entries: When you cast a spell, you can spend 1 Metamagic Point to cast it without any somatic or verbal components.

optionalfeature.name: Targeted Spell
entries: If you make a ranged attack roll for a spell, you can spend 2 Metamagic Points to ignore half cover and three-quarters cover.
You can use Targeted Spell even if you have already used a different Metamagic option during the casting of the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Transmuted Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that deals a type of damage from the following list, you can spend 1 Metamagic Point to change that damage type to one of the other listed types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, thunder.

optionalfeature.name: Twinned Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that targets only one creature and doesn't have a range of self, you can spend a number of Metamagic Points equal to the spell's level to target a second creature in range with the same spell (1 sorcery point if the spell is a cantrip).
To be eligible, a spell must be incapable of targeting more than one creature at the spell's current level.

optionalfeature.name: Widen Spell
entries: When you cast a spell of 1st through 5th-level that has a radius area of effect, you can spend a number of Metamagic Points equal to the spell's level +2 to increase its area of effect by half.
For example, fireball increases from a 20-foot-radius to 30-foot-radius.
